headline: Breaded Parmesan Ranch Chicken
description: Parmesan ranch chicken is ready in under an hour with just five simple ingredients.

video.description: Just five basic ingredients, and dinner’s ready in less than an hour.
video.name: Breaded Parmesan Ranch Chicken

name: Breaded Parmesan Ranch Chicken
recipeIngredient: 1 (1 ounce) envelope ranch salad dressing mix
8 (4 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Combine corn flakes, Parmesan cheese, and ranch dressing mix in a bowl. Dip chicken in melted butter; roll each chicken breast in corn flake mixture until evenly coated. Place coated chicken in the prepared baking dish.

Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: My kids LOVE this. We usually use Italian bread crumbs instead of corn flakes.

Soooo delicious and EASY!!! 

I used panko crumbs as the breading and it turned out amazing. This was the easiest recipe I've ever tried that turned out even better than expected.

I used liquid ranch dressing and mixed in a packet of Lipton’s onion soup mix marinated chicken all day in it then just coated it with grated Parmesan and cooked 40 minutes. It was fine as was without the flakes or butter and everyone loved it they asked me to only make it this way from now on. I served it with pesto noodles and roasted Parmesan asparagus
Love this recipe! Use cheddar sometimes instead of the parm and egg instead of butter, it's good both ways! Family loved it!
Very good. I used an egg instead of butter and cooked it in my Foodi grill. I will definitely make it again.
Very easy & tasty!! I used the fiesta ranch dip mix instead of plain ranch. Definitely a keeper!!
Didn't have cornflakes so I used Dot's Pretzel Crumble
Recipe had almost no flavor. Followed exactly as it was written. Thought it may have just been me, but my whole family said something about the lack of flavor.
Loved it!
Delicious!! Only made 2 breasts so adjusted (eyeballed) very flavorful and like other reviews, I would reduce the cooking time as mine came out a bit dry.
So easy! I used garlic herb spices instead of the dressing.
Quite delicious and very easy to make.
I think it was okay, not the best, but the chicken was moist but the crust wasn't crispy as I had hoped. I may tried it again.

Delicious my family and I loved it a great twist on breading. Different than Italian bread crumbs which have to be fried and way better than plain bread crumbs
MTDSFP
I used parmesan shredded cheese instead of the grated. Still tasted good. Maybe I used too much butter as well, but it still tasted good.

I though it was very good and delicious. My parents and siblings loved it. When you bake the chicken I would watch and drain the juices that appear when the chicken starts to cook. If you leave in the juices the bottom breading will get soggy.
Fantastic!! Will be making again. I can reduce the butter. Threw out probably half. Probably could reduce topping also or just use more chicken.
This recipe was delicious and a big hit with the family.
This recipe was delicious. Super easy to make and full of flavour. Definitely will make again.
Very good and super easy
This recipe is definitely going into my rotation - my husband and I loved it!! It’s so simple and great for me to throw together for a delicious quick dinner.
Super easy and family LOVED! We used bread crumbs vs corn flakes

Chicken turned out super juicy! I used panko bread crumbs and costco organic parmesan cheese. I didn't have any powdered ranch dressing mix, so I used bottled ranch dressing to dip the chicken in. Would definitely make again as it only took 5 minutes to prepare for the oven!
The coating was tasty but I had trouble keeping it from falling off. My husband it tasted a lot like fried chicken without the frying.
Followed recipe the chicken was amazing! Yes I would definitely make this again.
Super-Duper!! 10 stars, “more, please!”, “this is really good!”. Can you tell it’s going in the regular dinner rotation? They couldn’t resist one more bite! Great recipe!!!
Quick,easy simple meal. Paired it with a side salad and garlic mashed potatoes. And because we love our ranch had a side of that to dip the chicken. Was delicious and will definitely make again.
Easy and yummy!

I made it as per the recipe, although I did add Trader Joe's "21 Seasoning Salute" (salt-free blend...as we've got to watch our sodium intake). This was very easy and it was just something a little different for boneless skinless chicken breasts, which we have a lot. I'll be making this again.

I poked holes in the chicken with a fork then dipped the chicken in extra virgin olive oil. I combined Italian bread crumbs and ranch dip dry mix in a seperate bowl and dipped the chicken in it and baked at 350 for 45 minutes. juicy and full of flavor!! yummy!!!
I made this with Saltine crackers instead of corn flakes and halved the recipe. It was great! Even my super-picky husband liked it. Simple and tasty - will definitely make this one again!
It was very tasty... next time I think I will forego the melted butter and do an "egg wash" instead.
Made this recipe using the ritz crackers instead of corn flakes, came out amazing! I can’t wait to make it again!!
My family loves it, even the boy who won't eat anything!

I did Italian bread crumbs instead of corn flakes and instead of butter I used two eggs beaten and it came out delicious and the breading was beautiful and also I used kraft Parmesan cheese in it. I also agree that a cook time of 30 minutes will do fine. But of course I was using chicken breast tenderloins.
Very tender and juicy. Fast and easy to make. Will definitely make it again and my daughter loved it
I will definitely be making this again. Quick
Usded chicken tenderloins and crushed crackers instead of corn flakes. Delicious and easy!!!!!
This was sooooo goooood!!!!!
This was absolutely amazing! I used more of the called for ingredients, and Ritz crackers instead of cornflakes. I also paired it with Alfredo sauce and noodles. Tasted like Olive garden to me!!!!!
Will make it again.
It was a little salty but definitely a great quick chicken!!
Making this for the second time since we really liked it the first time. This time I only made half as much of the topping, as I found even with over 3 lbs of chicken, it is plenty.

This was really good! I followed the recipe exactly, as I always do the first time I make something. The chicken was moist and flavorful! My kids were disappointed when they gobbled it up and their wasn't any more! That's saying something, since all 3 of my kids are pretty picky! I will definitely make this again!

Didn't have cereal, so subbed w/ panko. This comes out somewhat crispy on exterior and moist on interior (which we loved)! The ranch mix makes it a bit salty though. But everyone loves it in our household!
i used panko instead of corn flakes. it turned out amazing
My husband and I loved this recipe. It was juicy and delicious.
Wouldn’t make any changes. Will definitely make this again. So simple to make, yet so delicious. 10/10 would recommend.
Loved it!
It was amazing!
You can probably decrease the crumbs and parm cheese by 20 %. Easy to make and very tasty.
husband liked this
Delicious, however, I used less butter. It’s so quick and easy...and a kid friendly dish!!

Yummmm!!! Made mostly as stated, except I cut my chicken into strips, used fresh grated parmesan cheese, and sprinkled garlic powder on the chicken before the coating process. I also made more of the breading because I made more. I took this advice from other reviewers. Turned out great! Baked at 375 for 25 minutes. Thanks for the recipe!
Super easy, few ingredients, awesome taste. My 15-yr-old son asked me to put it in my “regular rotation.’
GREAT
I've made this 3 times as my son loves it.
I simplified it by using egg, salt & pepper for the wetting, then dredged in ranch dressing powder & panko mixed. Delicious & moist!
I should have used the corn flakes I use bread crumbs not the same results. But it was good.
Used real bread crumbs instead of corn flakes. I also tossed the chicken in ranch dressing instead of melted butter. New fam favorite.

I read the reviews carefully and decided to use only half the ranch salad dressing mix. It turned out great and my very picky kids ate everything!
My husband and I loved it too!! 
I'll definitely make this again.
This has become a staple in our house. There isn’t a better chicken recipe to put on top of fettuccine alfredo. I always use panko bread crumbs instead of the corn flakes and it is always awesome.
Super easy and absolutely delicious! Even the kids loved It!
I made it without corn flakes replacing with some Goldfish from Pepperidge Farm. It was incredible
I used mayo instead of butter and it was good.

I made this exactly as written. It's a fantastic recipe. My family asks me to make it for every
gathering. I also make it for my Husband and myself. I do use chicken tenders for the recipe. I usually cook them about 25 minutes, uncovered. Do not overcook chicken, it will be dry and tough.
This recipe will make you a hero, guaranteed.
used same amount of bread crumbs instead of corn flakes. My husbands' Favorite chicken recipe of all time!

I made this for my husband and I and made it exactly as the recipe said. It was delicious. Of course, for just the two of us it was a lot of chicken but we ate the leftovers cold on a salad. I did turn the broiler on at the end for a little while to crisp up the top. It's so easy to make, great for a busy family.
I used the recipe as a general outline. I used Italian seasoned breadcrumbs instead of cornflakes and skipped the ranch seasoning packet.
Great recipe! I used bread crumbs instead of corn flakes. The chicken was very moist!!

I made this for our family and two additional families who were under the weather and needed a meal. Both asked for the recipe and gave it rave reviews! I used plain panko bread crumbs, and a combination of grated and shredded parmasean/romano cheeses. Also added a whipped egg to the butter mixture and a touch of milk to help the panko stick and lots of pepper. If you use panko, keep a close eye on it in the oven as it burns more rapidly than cornflakes or breadcrumbs. Served with baked garlic potato wedges and a salad--great meal!

Just okay. The chicken was moist and flavorful, but the mix of the ranch dressing and parmesan cheese was just bland. Something was missing..not sure what. So it wasn't bad, it was just okay. Next time I will consider additional seasonings.
I really like this recipe. Easy.
Delish! So glad I found this recipe. Crispy, flavorful, and easy!
This was on point, didn't change a thing. My 12 year old loved it and ate it all. That's saying something.

This was super east tyo make and oh so good. I didn't have any ranch dressing so I used Cesar dressing that I make on my own and I used Italian breadcrumbs since I had some on hand. Still good and now requested by my husband.
I thought it was pretty good, my family all liked it and agreed it was a keeper. Cook time is a little long, slightly dry, I'll shorten cook time next time.
Made as directed except I pounded the chicken breast to thin them out a bit. Chicken was moist and tender. It was great! A keeper.
I’ve made this several times and each time it’s a hit! It’s my go to dinner when I have limited time. I use mayonnaise and Italian style Panko bread crumbs.
made it just as the recipe instructs and it was AMAZING! Used Hidden Valley Ranch packet - the flavor is fantastic. I would try it with Ritz Crackers as well - would be YUMMY!

Excellent! I made a lot of changes, but the quantities were a wonderful guide. Instead of butter I used 1/3 cup Extra Virgin Olive Oil to dredge the chicken. I used 1/2 cup of generic bread crumbs instead of the corn flakes, and I used a little over 1 TBSP of homemade Ranch dressing mix. I also used shredded parmesan cheese, but recommend topping the chicken with it 25 minutes into cooking so it doesn't burn. Also, if you tenderize the chicken thin like I do beforehand then total cook time only needs to be 35 minutes. Use a glass dish for easier cleanup. Thanks for the great recipe idea!
This turned out perfect! Thanks for the simple instructions. I did add parsley as well as thyme seasoning.
Super easy to make and delicious! We turned them into nuggets! My son, a picky eater, ate 3 handfuls of them and proclaimed them delish! Didn't even use ketchup on them!
Pretty good. Used fresh parmesan. Came out a little dry so next time I would watch the cooking time and maybe take it out sooner. Otherwise good flavor and easy!

It's a very simple and tasty recipe. The tricky part is cooking chicken breast just right so it's fully cooked but not dry. If you use boneless chicken thighs, it's easier. 
We didn't have corn flakes so we used bread crumbs. It's very good.
The ranch dressing is already salty so do not add any salt!
Quick and easy. Taste delicious even the kiddo ate it.

This recipe was amazing.....Very flavorful I used panko bread crumbs that had parmesan cheese In it I added 1/2 cup of shredded sharp cheddar and every thing else was the same.....Thanks and Happy Cooking!!!!
This was absolutely delicious and I made it just as the recipe states!
how about fish

Tender and juicy. I did as most reviewers suggested and reduced cooking time to 25-30 minutes. I also used the crushed Ritz crackers. But personally, Ritz are not what they used t be; I could have used pancko or breadcrumbs; the flavour is in the dressing. It was a delicious, easy weekday meal.

I used bottled buttermilk ranch and olive oil as replacements. I also combined my crushed flakes with garlic seasoned bread crumbs. I coated my pan with the olive oil to prevent sticking as well as to help crispen the chicken. Then I dipped the chicken breasts in the ranch dressing. Then coated the pieces in the corn flakes/bread crumbs. Layed the chicken in the coated pan and baked for approx. 45 min until done. Came out great, ate with mashed potatoes and veggies.
Excellent! Made with panko crumbs. Used leftovers in sandwiches; with gravy and mozzarella. Delicious !!! A new weekly favorite.
I made it exactly as it was written and it was delicious although for my oven, it needed only 30 minutes before it was done! My whole family loved it!

Except for scaling down for 2 servings, I made this exactly as written. I did not use corn flakes, I used corn flake crumbs, so that may have been the problem. Too bland, not crisped enough. My husband thought it was fine, so I may use actual cornflakes and possibly egg to dip the chicken in. I also may make a full recipe to see if that makes a difference. It's so easy to make that if I can get it to have something extra, it might be worth tinkering with.
Awesome and so easy! I substituted Ritz crackers for the corn flakes since I didn't have any on hand. I'll definitely make it again!
The whole family loved it! To cut down on carbs (or if you are following Paleo) we used pork rinds instead of Corn Flakes and it came it out awesome!

This recipe is fantastic. I know that recipes should be graded as given, but I didn't have corn flakes, so I just used bread crumbs. It is a very flavorful chicken recipe that is very easy to make, and it has quickly become one of my wife's and my favorite recipes. We make it almost weekly now.

Love this recipe, made it twice so far.. Felt that the corn flakes were a little bland in flavor so i substituted for frosted flakes. Adds a sweet flavor to the breading but not overwhelming.. 5 stars
I didn't have cornflakes so I used Panky breadcrumbs. Delicious recipe, everyone enjoyed it. I will be using this again
